author: Special Correspondent
text:
St. Joseph’s College will be celebrating the ‘Heritage College Day’ on March 16, marking yet another milestone in the history of 172-year-old institution.

Addressing the media here on Monday, Rev. S. John Britto, Rector, said the University Grants Commission had accorded heritage status to the college on various parameters that ranged from the academic achievement, infrastructure such as historical museum and rich collection of species in herbarium.

Rev. John Britto said the college had been exploring new horizons and the extension department under its Shepherd programme, had set a trend in shaping the students into agents of social change. As per the programme, students of all departments should take part in rural development – one of the eligibility norms for receiving degree certificate. The college has been sanctioned Rs. 1.67 crore to extend its existing museum and herbarium buildings. Certificate and diploma courses on heritage conservation would be introduced shortly.

Rev. S. Sebastian, SJ, Secretary and F. Andrew SJ, Principal, said the honour would be a feather on the cap of the institute. They said that the glory of the institute can be gauged from the fact that it was started well before the Madras University. In the past, whenever the post of Vice-Chancellor in Madras University was vacant, the Principal of this college was holding additional charge as the Vice-Chancellor of the university.

Special arrangements

Rev. John Britto said special arrangements had been made for the celebrations. A documentary on the heritage of the college would be screened.

G. Srinvas, Joint Secretary of UGC eastern Regional Office, Hyderabad, would be the chief guest.
title: St. Joseph’s to observe Heritage College Day tomorrow
